column2: Conduct consultations with patients to discuss their aesthetic goals, medical history, and surgical options, and develop personalized treatment plans tailored to their needs and expectations.        Perform cosmetic surgical procedures, including breast augmentation, rhinoplasty, facelift, liposuction, abdominoplasty, and body contouring, to enhance patients' appearance and self-confidence.      Perform reconstructive surgical procedures, including breast reconstruction, skin grafting, microsurgery, and scar revision, to restore form and function following trauma, cancer surgery, or congenital abnormalities.      Evaluate patients for candidacy for surgical procedures, including assessing medical suitability, evaluating risk factors, and obtaining informed consent.      Coordinate pre-operative and post-operative care for surgical patients, including pre-operative assessments, surgical planning, and post-operative follow-up visits to monitor recovery and address any concerns.      Collaborate with other members of the healthcare team, including anesthesiologists, nurses, and support staff, to ensure safe and efficient patient care throughout the surgical process.      Stay informed about the latest developments in plastic surgery techniques, technologies, and products through participation in continuing medical education (CME) activities and professional development opportunities.      Adhere to all relevant laws, regulations, and ethical standards governing plastic surgery practice, patient care, and confidentiality.          Qualification: MS.,Mch Plastic surgery              Experience: 0-3 years Experienced doctors preferred            Gender: Male/Female            Language Required: Any South Indian Language            Duty Time: 8hrs duty and emergency on call            Type of Duty: OP/IP/OT

Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for Consultant Plastic Surgery  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    As a Technician in Plastic Surgery, you would play a vital role in assisting plastic surgeons and other medical professionals in various aspects of plastic surgery procedures     Your responsibilities may include:Preparing Surgical Equipment: Sterilizing and setting up surgical instruments, equipment, and supplies needed for plastic surgery procedures     Ensuring that all necessary tools are available and in working condition     Assisting in Surgeries: Providing direct assistance to plastic surgeons during surgical procedures     This may involve handing instruments, sutures, and other surgical tools to the surgeon, holding retractors, and assisting with wound closure     Patient Preparation: Assisting in the preoperative preparation of patients, such as positioning them on the operating table, ensuring their comfort, and applying sterile drapes to maintain a sterile surgical environment     Wound Care and Dressing: Assisting with postoperative wound care, including cleaning and dressing wounds, monitoring for signs of infection or complications, and ensuring proper healing
